se.lypson.common.thread
Class Thread

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      se.lypson.common.thread.Thread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Thread
extends java.lang.Thread

The Thread class extends the java.lang.Thread class by adding Observer Pattern functionality as well as giving the thread function the possibility to return a result value.

Sub classes should override the threadMain method, not the run method as is the case with the java.lang.Thread class. If the thread is constructed with an instance of Runnable as parameter, the runnable's run method is called instead of the threadMain method. The thread main method is either threadMain or the runnable's run method, depending on which one is called.

If the main thread method is threadMain, after the threads main method has finished, the value returned by the threadMain method is available through the getThreadResult method. If the thread main method is a runnable's run method, the result value returned by getThreadResult is always null.

If an exception occurs during the execution of the thread main method, getThreadException will contain the thrown exception object and getThreadResult will return null. If no exception occurs, getThreadException returns null.

Observers are notified when the execution of the main thread has completed, either successfully or by throwing an exception. (However, they are not notified if an java.lang.Error is thrown.) Note that the thread is still alive when the observers are notified of the threads completion. Observers are also notified when the thread sends messages. Only sub classes of this class can send messages, not threads started with a Runnable.

Author:
Tobias Persson

Method Detail

threadMain

public java.lang.Object threadMain()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
The threads main function if the thread is not constructed with a Runnable as parameter. This method should be overridden by sub classes.

Returns:
null, always. Sub classes may return other values.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - never thrown. Sub classes may throw exceptions.

run

public final void run()
The threads run method; this is the method that is called when the thread is started. This method calls the thread main method.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

getThreadResult

public java.lang.Object getThreadResult()
Returns the thread result.

Returns:
The thread result.

getThreadException

public java.lang.Exception getThreadException()
Returns the thread exception.

Returns:
The thread exception; or null if no exception was thrown during the exedcution of the thread.

addThreadObserver

public void addThreadObserver(IThreadObserver observer)
Adds a new observer that will be notified when the thread sends messages or has finished executing.

Parameters:
observer - the new observer

removeThreadObserver

public void removeThreadObserver(IThreadObserver observer)
Removes an observer from the list of observers to be notified when the thread sends messages or has finished execution.

Parameters:
observer - the observer to remove.

notifyObserversMessage

protected void notifyObserversMessage(java.lang.Object message)
Notifies all observers that the thread has sent a message.
